title: Promote approved Version 25 to production (no changes)

requirements.text: Publish the user-approved preview deployment (Version 25) to the live/production site with no code or content changes, so it becomes the active main version that users see when visiting the app.

quotes: Yes please publish this version no changes needed all is fine everything

acceptanceCriteria: Production deployment is promoted from the exact approved Version 25 build/commit (no additional changes introduced).
Visiting the production URL loads Version 25 as the active main version.
No preview-only URL parameters, version query strings, or debug labels are visible in the production UI (release mode behavior remains intact).

requirements.text: After promoting Version 25 to production, perform a production smoke test using the checklist in frontend/PRODUCTION_SMOKE_TEST.md to confirm the core Valentine flow works end-to-end in production.

quotes: Yes please publish this version no changes needed all is fine everything

acceptanceCriteria: Smoke test is completed on at least 2 browsers and 2 device types as suggested by the checklist.

The following core flow passes in production: Welcome screen → Start button starts background music → quiz progression (no advance on wrong answers) → quiz completion → final page → “Open Our Memories” reveal → memories gallery thumbnails render → lightbox opens/closes → love letter text is visible and readable.
Any failures are documented with notes sufficient to reproduce (or the run is marked as fully passing).

constraints: Do not implement any new features or UI/content changes; this request is publish-only.
Respect the existing single-actor Motoko backend architecture; do not introduce migrations unless strictly required (not expected for publish-only).
Do not modify any frontend files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Bug fixes unrelated to publishing the already-approved Version 25.
Adding or changing quiz questions, love letter text, memories images, or backend data.
